text: Prepare the pudding basin. Grease it using the extra amount of butter or margarine. Spoon all of the marmalade into the bottom of the greased pudding basin.  In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar. Add the egg and stir. Sift in the flour and salt. Fold through. Pour the baking soda into the hot milk. Once it has dissolved, add to the pudding mixture and stir through. Pour the mixture into the pudding basin. Cover with a lid or greaseproof paper attached with string. Place the pudding basin into a large saucepan. Fill the saucepan with water to reach halfway up the sides of the pudding basin. Steam gently for 30 minutes (half an hour).  Remove the pudding. Turn it over onto a serving dish. Serve with the custard (hot or cold as preferred).
